title.value: Neural correlates of local parallelism during naturalistic vision
title.justification: The title clearly states the focus of the research paper on discovering neural correlates associated with local parallelism during naturalistic vision.
title.quote: Neural correlates of local parallelism during naturalistic vision

extractions.description: This study investigates the neural mechanisms underlying local parallelism as a perceptual grouping cue during naturalistic vision. It utilizes fMRI data, including publicly available datasets like BOLD5000, to explore how parallelism affects scene categorization and neural activation in different brain regions such as V1, V4, PPA, and RSC.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results from two fMRI studies, including data analysis and observations regarding the neural response to parallelism in vision.
type.quote: Using a new, image-computable algorithm for detecting local symmetry in line drawings and photographs, we manipulated the local parallelism content of real-world scenes.

name.justification: The study focuses on neural correlates in the brain related to visual perception, a core topic in neuroscience.
name.quote: We decoded scene categories from patterns of brain activity obtained via functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI).

name.justification: The research dives into the perception of vision focusing on parallelism, providing insights into visual processing.
name.quote: We here uncover the neural mechanisms of one important perceptual grouping cue, local parallelism.

name.justification: The BOLD5000 dataset is used extensively in the paper for the fMRI analysis of scene viewing in the context of visual parallelism.
name.quote: Files from experiment 2 are taken from the BOLD5000 dataset, available at https://bold5000-dataset.github.io/website/index.html.
